Name: encounter_id
Description and valuation: An unique number to identify an encounter.

Name: patient_nbr
Description and valuation: An unique number to identify a patient.

Name: race
Description and valuation: The race of a patient with values: Caucasian, Asian, African American, Hispanic, and other.

Name: gender
Description and valuation: The gender of a patient with values: male, female, and unknown/invalid.

Name: age
Description and valuation: The age of a patient, grouped in ten-year intervals, for example: [0, 10) and [90, 100).

Name: weight
Description and valuation: Weight in pounds.

Name: adminsion_type_id
Description and valuation: An integer identifying what a patient's admission type is, which corresponds with a method, for example:1 - emergency and 2 - urgent. Valuation has nine distinct values.

Name: discharge_disposition_id
Description and valuation: An integer identifying how a patient was discharged, which corresponds with a method, for example: 1 - discharged to home and 2 - expired. Valuation has 29 distinct values.

Name: admission_source_id
Description and valuation: An integer identifying how a patient was admitted to hospital, which corresponds with a method, for example: 1 - physician referral and 2 - emergency room. Valuation has 21 distinct values.

Name: time_in_hospital
Description and valuation: Integer number of days between admission and discharge.

Name: payer_code
Description and valuation: An integer identifying how a patient is paying, which corresponds with a method, for example: 1 - Blue Cross/Blue Shield and 2 - Medicare. Valuatoon has 23 distinct values.

Name: medical_specialty
Description and valuation: An integer identifying the specialty of the admitting physician, which corresponds with a method, for example: 1 - cardiology and 2 - internal medicine. Valuation has 84 distinct values.

Name: num_lab_procedures
Description and valuation: Number of lab tests performed during the encounter.

Name: num_procedures
Description and valuation: Number of procedures, other than lab tests, performed during the encounter.

Name: num_medications
Description and valuation: Number of distinct generic names administered during the encounter.

Name: number_outpatient
Description and valuation: Number of outpatient visits of the patient in the year preceding the encounter.

Name: number_emergency
Description and valuation: Number of emergency visits of the patient in the year preceding the encounter.

Name: number_inpatient
Description and valuation: Number of inpatient visits of the patient in the year preceding the encounter.

Name: diag_1
Description and valuation: The primary diagnosis and is coded as first three digits of ICD9, with 848 distinct values.

Name: diag_2
Description and valuation: The secondary diagnosis and is coded as first three digits of ICD9, with 923 distinct values.

Name: diag_3
Description and valuation: An additional secondary diagnosis and is coded as first three digits of ICD9, with 954 distinct values.

Name: number_diagnoses
Description and valuation: Number of diagnoses entered to the system.

Name: max_glu_serum
Description and valuation: Indicates the range of the result or if the test was not taken. Values: ">200", ">300" and "normal" if the test is taken, and "none" if the test is not taken.

Name: A1Cresult
Description and valuation: Indicates the range of the result or if the test was not taken. Values: ">8%" if result was greater than 8%, "7%" if result was greater than 7% but less than 8%, "normal" if the test was less than 7%, and "none" if no test was taken.

Name: metformin
Description and valuation: Indicates whether the drug was prescribed or there was a change in dosage. Values: "up" if the dosage was increased, "down" if the dosage was decreased, "steady" if there was no change in dosage, and "No" if the drug was not prescribed.

Name: change
Description and valuation: Indicates if medication was changed, with values: 'Change' or 'No change'.

Name: diabetesMed
Description and valuation: Indicates if diabetes medication was prescribed, with values: 'Yes' and 'No'.

Name: readmitted
Description and valuation: Days to inpatient readmission, with values: "<30" if the patient was readmitted in less than 30 days, ">30" if the patient was readmitted in more than 30 days, and 'NO' for no record of readmission.
